oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Superior optical properties of Si-nanocrystals (Si-NCs) compared with bulk Si, particularly tunability of bandgap by controlling size, can be exploited for realizing next-generation Si tandem solar cells. In view of this, optical bandgap tunability of Si-NCs fabricated by Inductively Coupled Plasma Enhanced Chemical Vapor Deposition (ICPCVD) is presented. The SiOx<2/SiO2 superlattice approach was used for realizing Si-NCs with tight size control. Deposition time of SiOx sublayer and, hence, the related thickness (T-SRO), was used as a variable parameter to realize Si-NCs of varying sizes. Formation of Si-NCs was verified by transmission electron microscopy and Raman spectroscopy. Using XPS analysis, the stoichiometry parameter x was estimated to be 0.82 for SiOx sublayer. The optical bandgap E-Tauc estimated using Tauc analysis was observed to be tunable from 1.57 to 2.52 eV as the size of Si-NCs was varied from 5.8 (+/- 0.5) to 2 (+/- 0.4) nm, respectively.
